text: Ardem Patapoutian (; born 1967) is an Armenian-American molecular biologist and neuroscientist. He is known for his works about PIEZO1, PIEZO2, and TRPM8 receptors. He is a professor at Scripps Research in La Jolla, California. Patapoutian won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2021 with David Julius. ==References== ==Other websites== * Ardem Patapoutian, PhD at Scripps Research (scripps.edu) * The Patapoutian Lab (patapoutianlab.org) * CV Patapoutian * Ardem Patapoutian, PhD at Howard Hughes Medical Institute (hhmi.org) * Ardem Patapoutian in Academic Tree (neurotree.org) Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Armenian writers Category:American biologists Category:Scientists from San Diego Category:Writers from San Diego Category:People from Beirut
title: Ardem Patapoutian
